meanings.definition: To arrange or deal with in order of importance
meanings.sent1: She prioritized her homework before watching TV.
meanings.sent2: The team prioritized safety over speed during the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat prioritized napping over catching mice.
meanings.sent4: His health was prioritized like a precious gem in his life.
meanings.sent5: Prioritizing your goals is like creating a roadmap for success.

meanings.definition: To designate or treat as more important
meanings.sent1: He prioritized his family's needs above his own.
meanings.sent2: The manager prioritized customer satisfaction above all else.
meanings.sent3: The dog prioritized belly rubs over treats.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was prioritized like a crown on her head.
meanings.sent5: Prioritizing kindness can make a big difference in someone's day.

meanings.definition: To organize or deal with according to priority
meanings.sent1: They prioritized the tasks based on deadlines.
meanings.sent2: The teacher prioritized the lesson plans for the week.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prioritized gathering nuts over socializing.
meanings.sent4: Time was prioritized like a scarce resource in their planning.
meanings.sent5: Prioritizing your time can lead to better productivity.
